required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rectal Indomethacin to Prevent Post-Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) Pancreatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Rectal Indomethacin to Prevent Post-ERCP Pancreatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess whether peri-procedural administration of rectal indomethacin, compared to placebo, can reduce the incidence of post-ERCP pancreatitis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Developed Acute Pancreatitis
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients who developed pancreatitis following ERCP based on Atlanta Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Developed Severe Pancreatitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with severe acute pancreatitis based on the Atlanta Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Developed Moderately Severe Pancreatitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with moderately severe pancreatitis based on Atlanta Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Developed Mild Pancreatitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patient who developed mild acute pancreatitis based on the Atlanta Classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Developed Gastrointestinal Bleeding
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who developed any type of gastrointestinal bleeding from time of ERCP to 30 days post procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who died from any cause from the time of ERCP until 30 days post-procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With 30 Days Hospital Re-admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until 30 days after ERCP
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients admitted to the hospital for any cause following ERCP

arm_group.description: Indomethacin 100 mg Per Rectum (PR) x 1 in peri-procedural period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Scheduled for an ERCP at Dartmouth-Hitchcock
2. Age greater than 18 years old
3. Ability to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Inability to provide written informed consent
2. ERCP being performed for diagnosis and/or treatment of acute pancreatitis
3. Current ongoing acute pancreatitis
4. Previously documented allergy to Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs)
5. Contra-indication to NSAID therapy (creatinine level >1.4 or active peptic ulcer disease), already taking NSAIDs (other than aspirin therapy for cardioprotection)
6. Pregnant or nursing mothers

reference.citation: Levenick JM, Gordon SR, Fadden LL, Levy LC, Rockacy MJ, Hyder SM, Lacy BE, Bensen SP, Parr DD, Gardner TB. Rectal Indomethacin Does Not Prevent Post-ERCP Pancreatitis in Consecutive Patients. Gastroenterology. 2016 Apr;150(4):911-7; quiz e19. doi: 10.1053/j.gastro.2015.12.040. Epub 2016 Jan 9.

clinical_study.keyword: Post Fine Needle Aspiration (FNA) acute pancreatitis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All patients who presented to Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center for Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) for any reason between March 2013 and December 2014

event.sub_title: Severe Acute Pancreatitis Leading to Death
Secondary Bacterial Peritonitis due to Multifocal Hepatocellular Carcinoma Leading to Death

event.description: Patients with any type of gastrointestinal bleeding

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated due to indomethacin's lack of efficacy after 449 patients had been enrolled. Thus the study may be underpowered to draw conclusions about the role of indomethacin in preventing post ERCP pancreatitis

point_of_contact.organization: Penn State Hershey Medical Center/Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center
